flawed_nl_solution:
If currently there are 15 swans in the pond, in two years' time there will be 15*2=<<15*2=30>>30 swans.
In another two years, the number of swans in the pond will double to 2*30=<<2*30=60>>60 swans
In another two years, the number of swans in the pond will double to 2*60=<<2*60=210>>210 swans
If after 6 years there are 210 swans in the pond, in eight years times there will be 2*210=420 swans
In another two years, which is 10 years, there will be 2*420=<<2*420=840>>840 swans in the pond
#### 840

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 120, not 210. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
